name: Body of Lord Blackwood
description: Lord Blackwood lies slumped in his leather armchair, looking like he fell asleep mid-sentence. His skin is clammy and pale, and his lips have a distinct bluish tint, suggesting respiratory failure. His eyes are staring blankly, the pupils dangerously dilated. A faint, acrid smell—bitter, not sweet—lingers on his breath.
staticMessage: You shouldn't tamper with the crime scene. The positioning of the body is crucial evidence.

name: Brass Key
description: A heavy brass key with the Blackwood crest. Mary was holding onto it.

name: Black Leather Journal
description: Lord Blackwood's private journal. The entries are erratic and cruel. The final entry, dated today, reads: 'Victoria... I know about her little dalliances. I shall rewrite the will. Neither of them will get a penny. Better to fund the public good than that harpy and ingrate. But the Blackwood name...'

name: Silver Letter Opener
description: A sharp, silver letter opener shaped like a dagger. It is clean and polished.

name: Torn Will Fragment
description: A scrap of legal paper torn from a larger document. It reads: '...to my beloved brother Arthur, I leave nothing but my contempt and the forgiveness of his debts, provided he never sets foot...' The rest is missing.

name: Arsenic Bottle
description: A dusty bottle marked 'Arsenic - For Rate Control'.

name: Crumpled Letter
description: A letter found in the wastebasket. 'Dearest Alistair, the child is yours. You cannot ignore us forever. I am coming to Blackwood Manor to demand what is owed. - S'

name: Broken Wine Glass
description: Shards of dark green glass from a shattered wine bottle are scattered in the corner. It looks like a crate was shoved violently. The wine has soaked into the stone floor, staining it like blood.
staticMessage: You shouldn't touch the glass with bare hands.

name: Burnt Will Ashes
description: A pile of ash in the fireplace. It is beyond repair and not recoverable, but you can see the faint, charred header of a legal document.
staticMessage: It would crumble to dust at your touch. The document is destroyed.

name: Heavy Iron Safe
description: A heavy iron safe sits in the corner. It looks impenetrable without the key. It is currently locked.
staticMessage: It is far too heavy to move.

name: Little Black Notebook
description:
A small, well-worn notebook filled with Jeeves' meticulous handwriting. It logs visitor times and staff infractions. Several entries stand out:
- 'V and A need to hide themselves better, I'm sure M has noticed.'
- 'So many overheard arguments with M today... V in bedroom? A in cellar? S in library? PT in conservatory? Who is S anyway?.'
- 'M is manic about new will, carries it everywhere now.'
- 'M informed me of the termination of my service. The pension fund is dissolved. 50 years of service, erased. I should have gotten my cut from P'

name: Botany of British Flora
description:
A heavy leather-bound volume. You find three bookmarks of interest:
1. **Strychnos Nux-vomica**: Causes rigid muscles, arching of the back, and a fixed grin.
2. **Arsenicum (Arsenic)**: Induces violent vomiting, convulsions, and severe gastric distress.
3. **Aconitum Napellus (Wolfsbane)**: Causes tingling, numbness of the mouth, respiratory paralysis, and pronounced dilation of the pupils.

name: Umbrella Stand
description: A brass stand filled with dripping black umbrellas.
staticMessage: You don't need an umbrella inside.

name: Portrait of Colonel Blackwood
description: An imposing oil painting of the manor's founder. His eyes seem to follow you with disapproval.
staticMessage: It is firmly mounted to the wall.

name: Chess Set
description: An onyx and ivory chess set. Black is in checkmate.

name: Antique Globe
description: A dusty globe from the 19th century. The borders are all wrong.

name: Silver Candelabra
description: A heavy three-armed candlestick. The wax has dripped down the side.

name: Copper Kettle
description: A large kettle sitting on the cold stove.

name: Black Dahlia
description: A rare, dark flower with velvety petals. It looks almost menacing.
staticMessage: Best not to distrub the delicate roots.

name: Velvet Rope
description: A red rope barrier, likely used to cordon off sections during larger parties.

name: Crystal Perfume Bottle
description: An elegant bottle of lavender scent. It smells cloying and sweet.

name: The London Times
description: Yesterday's paper. The headline screams about the rising storm.

name: Medical Journal
description: A copy of 'The Lancet'. It has been dog-eared at an article about toxicology.

name: Chateau Blackwood 1890
description: An incredibly rare vintage. It's covered in decades of dust.

name: Police Whistle
description: Standard issue Scotland Yard whistle. Hopefully, you won't need to blow it.

name: Lace Handkerchief
description: A delicate handkerchief embroidered with 'V.B.'. It is damp with tears.

name: Gold Sovereign
description: An old coin Arthur flips nervously. He claims it's lucky, though his debts suggest otherwise.

name: Gold Pocket Watch
description: A precision timepiece. Thorne checks it constantly.

name: Red Feather Boa
description: A glamorous, if slightly molting, accessory.

name: White Gloves
description: Spare gloves, perfectly starched and pristine.

name: Polishing Rag
description: A simple cloth smelling of beeswax and lemon.

name: Silver Tasting Spoon
description: Pierre's personal spoon. He doesn't let anyone else touch it.

name: Grandfather Clock
description: A towering mahogany clock. Its pendulum swings with a hypnotic, rhythmic tick... tock... tick... tock.
staticMessage: It is far too heavy to move.
